verses.verse: After <S%G3326><s%> these things <S%G5023><s%> he <S%G3972><s%> departed <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> Athens <S%G116><s%>, and came <S%G2064><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Corinth <S%G2882><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> he found <S%G2147><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> Jew <S%G2453><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Aquila <S%G207><s%>, a man of Pontus <S%G4193><s%> by race <S%G1085><s%>, lately <S%G4373><s%> come <S%G2064><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Italy <S%G2482><s%>, with <S%G2532><s%> his <S%G846><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> Priscilla <S%G4252><s%>, because <S%G1223><s%> Claudius <S%G2804><s%> had commanded <S%G1299><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> to depart <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> Rome <S%G4516><s%>: and he came <S%G4334><s%> unto them <S%G846><s%>;

and <S%G2532><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> he was <S%G1511><s%> of the same trade <S%G3673><s%>, he abode <S%G3306><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> they wrought <S%G2038><s%>, for <S%G1063><s%> by their trade <S%G5078><s%> they were tentmakers <S%G4635><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> he reasoned <S%G1256><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the synagogue4864, 2596 every <S%G3956><s%> sabbath <S%G4521><s%>, and <S%G5037><s%> persuaded <S%G3982><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Greeks <S%G1672><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when5613, Deuteronomy37 Silas <S%G4609><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> Timothy <S%G5095><s%> came <S%G2718><s%> down from <S%G575><s%> Macedonia <S%G3109><s%>, Paul <S%G3972><s%> was constrained <S%G4912><s%> by the word <S%G4151><s%>, testifying <S%G1263><s%> to the Jews <S%G2453><s%> that Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was the Christ <S%G5547><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when they opposed <S%G498><s%> themselves <S%G846><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> blasphemed <S%G987><s%>, he shook <S%G1621><s%> out his raiment <S%G2440><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, Your <S%G5216><s%> blood <S%G129><s%> be upon <S%G1909><s%> your own <S%G5216><s%> heads <S%G2776><s%>; I <S%G1473><s%> am clean <S%G2513><s%>: from <S%G575><s%> henceforth <S%G3568><s%> I will go <S%G4198><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> he departed <S%G3327><s%> thence <S%G1564><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> went into <S%G1519><s%> the house <S%G3614><s%> of a certain <S%G5100><s%> man named <S%G3686><s%> Titus Justus <S%G2459><s%>, one that <S%G3739><s%> worshipped <S%G4576><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>, whose <S%G3588><s%> house3614, 2258 joined hard <S%G4927><s%> to the synagogue <S%G4864><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> Crispus <S%G2921><s%>, the ruler of the synagogue <S%G752><s%>, believed <S%G4100><s%> in the Lord <S%G2962><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> his <S%G846><s%> house <S%G3624><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> of the Corinthians <S%G2881><s%> hearing <S%G191><s%> believed <S%G4100><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> were baptized <S%G907><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> unto Paul <S%G3972><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the night <S%G3571><s%> by <S%G1223><s%> a vision <S%G3705><s%>, Be <S%G5399><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> afraid <S%G5399><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> speak <S%G2980><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> hold <S%G4623><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> thy peace <S%G4623><s%>:

for <S%G1360><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> no man <S%G3762><s%> shall set <S%G2007><s%> on thee <S%G4671><s%> to harm <S%G2559><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>: for <S%G1360><s%> I <S%G3427><s%> have <S%G2076><s%> much <S%G4183><s%> people <S%G2992><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> city <S%G4172><s%>.

And <S%G5037><s%> he dwelt <S%G2523><s%> there a year <S%G1763><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> six <S%G1803><s%> months <S%G3376><s%>, teaching <S%G1321><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them <S%G846><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when Gallio <S%G1058><s%> was proconsul <S%G445><s%> of Achaia <S%G882><s%>, the Jews <S%G2453><s%> with one accord <S%G3661><s%> rose <S%G2721><s%> up against Paul <S%G3972><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> brought <S%G71><s%> him <S%G846><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> the judgment-seat <S%G968><s%>,
saying <S%G3754><s%>, This <S%G3778><s%> man persuadeth <S%G374><s%> men <S%G444><s%> to worship <S%G4576><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> contrary to <S%G3844><s%> the law <S%G3551><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> was about <S%G3195><s%> to open <S%G455><s%> his mouth <S%G4750><s%>, Gallio <S%G1058><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, If <S%G3303><s%> indeed it were <S%G2258><s%> a <S%G3767><s%> matter <S%G5100><s%> of <S%G5599><s%> wrong <S%G92><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of wicked <S%G4190><s%> villany <S%G5599><s%>, O ye Jews <S%G2453><s%>, reason <S%G3056><s%> would that <S%G2596><s%> I <S%G302><s%> should bear <S%G430><s%> with you <S%G5216><s%>:

but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they are <S%G2076><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> words <S%G3056><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> names <S%G3686><s%> and2532, 2596 your <S%G5209><s%> own law <S%G3551><s%>, look <S%G3700><s%> to it yourselves <S%G846><s%>; <S%G1063><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am not <S%G3756><s%> minded <S%G1014><s%> to be <S%G1511><s%> a judge <S%G2923><s%> of these matters <S%G5130><s%>.
And <S%G2532><s%> he drove <S%G556><s%> them <S%G846><s%> from <S%G575><s%> the judgment-seat <S%G968><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> they <S%G1672><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> laid hold <S%G1949><s%> on Sosthenes <S%G4988><s%>, the ruler of the synagogue <S%G752><s%>, and beat <S%G5180><s%> him before <S%G1715><s%> the judgment-seat <S%G968><s%>. And <S%G2532><s%> Gallio <S%G1058><s%> cared for <S%G3199><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> of these things <S%G5130><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, having tarried <S%G4357><s%> after this yet <S%G2089><s%> many <S%G2425><s%> days <S%G2250><s%>, took his leave <S%G657><s%> of the brethren <S%G80><s%>, and sailed thence <S%G1602><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> Syria <S%G4947><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> him <S%G846><s%> Priscilla <S%G4252><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Aquila <S%G207><s%>: having shorn <S%G2751><s%> his head <S%G2776><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> Cenchreae <S%G2747><s%>; for <S%G1063><s%> he had <S%G2192><s%> a vow <S%G2171><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> they came <S%G2658><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Ephesus <S%G2181><s%>, and <S%G2548><s%> he left them <S%G2641><s%> there <S%G847><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> he <S%G1525><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the synagogue <S%G4864><s%>, and reasoned <S%G1256><s%> with the Jews <S%G2453><s%>.
And when <S%G1161><s%> they <S%G846><s%> asked <S%G2065><s%> him to <S%G1909><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> a longer4119, 3844, 846 time <S%G5550><s%>, he consented <S%G1962><s%> not <S%G3756><s%>;

but <S%G235><s%> taking <S%G657><s%> his leave <S%G657><s%> of them <S%G846><s%>, and saying <S%G2036><s%>, I will return <S%G344><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> if <S%G2309><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> will <S%G2309><s%>, he <S%G2532><s%> set sail <S%G321><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Ephesus <S%G2181><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> when he had landed <S%G2718><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>, he went up <S%G305><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> saluted <S%G782><s%> the church <S%G1577><s%>, and went down <S%G2597><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Antioch <S%G490><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> having spent <S%G4160><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> time <S%G5550><s%> there <S%G1831><s%>, he departed, and went through <S%G1330><s%> the region <S%G5561><s%> of Galatia <S%G1054><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> Phrygia <S%G5435><s%>, in order <S%G2517><s%>, establishing <S%G1991><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the disciples <S%G3101><s%>.

Now <S%G1161><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> Jew <S%G2453><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Apollos <S%G625><s%>, an Alexandrian <S%G221><s%> by race <S%G1085><s%>, an eloquent <S%G3052><s%> man <S%G435><s%>, came <S%G2658><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Ephesus <S%G2181><s%>; and <S%G5607><s%> he was mighty <S%G1415><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the scriptures <S%G1124><s%>.

This man <S%G3778><s%> had been <S%G2258><s%> instructed <S%G2727><s%> in the way <S%G3598><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> being fervent <S%G2204><s%> in spirit <S%G4151><s%>, he spake <S%G2980><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> taught <S%G1321><s%> accurately <S%G199><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> Jesus <S%G2962><s%>, knowing <S%G1987><s%> only <S%G3440><s%> the baptism <S%G908><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%>:

and <S%G5037><s%> he <S%G3778><s%> began <S%G756><s%> to speak boldly <S%G3955><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the synagogue <S%G1161><s%>. But when <S%G191><s%> Priscilla <S%G4252><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Aquila <S%G207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, they took <S%G4355><s%> him <S%G846><s%> unto <S%G4355><s%> them <S%G2532><s%>, and expounded <S%G1620><s%> unto him <S%G846><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> more accurately <S%G199><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when he <S%G846><s%> was minded <S%G1014><s%> to pass <S%G1330><s%> over into <S%G1519><s%> Achaia <S%G882><s%>, the brethren <S%G80><s%> encouraged <S%G4389><s%> him <S%G1125><s%>, and wrote to the disciples <S%G3101><s%> to receive <S%G588><s%> him <S%G846><s%>: and <S%G3739><s%> when he was come <S%G3854><s%>, he helped them <S%G4820><s%> much <S%G4183><s%> that <S%G3588><s%> had believed <S%G4100><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> grace <S%G5485><s%>;

for <S%G1063><s%> he powerfully <S%G2159><s%> confuted <S%G1246><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, and that publicly <S%G1219><s%>, showing <S%G1925><s%> by <S%G1223><s%> the scriptures <S%G1124><s%> that <S%G1925><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was <S%G1511><s%> the Christ <S%G5547><s%>.
